business.headline: Why banks are using IVR checks for high-value UPI paymentsOne of the most common safety steps used today is IVR verification, where banks confirm a transaction through an automated phone call before money is transferred.

Global tech selloff hits Indian IT stocks: Could this trigger more layoffs?AI has started influencing how the IT industry works and hires. Understanding today's developments helps IT professionals see where the real opportunities are and what adjustments may be needed over time.

Deepinder Goyal calls ex-employees back to Zomato, says I want you backAccording to Goyal, the company already has more than 400 employees who are currently in their second or third stint with the group.

Why Anthropic's new AI tools rattled Wall Street's tech giants, hit Indian IT stocksThe slide in IT stocks is not just about prices. It reflects the new uncertainty AI brings to global tech. Knowing what sparked it helps decode what lies ahead for the sector.

How buying gold on an app is pushing real gold prices higherIt is not just safe haven demand or industrial demand alone driving gold and silver prices higher. A quiet shift in how people buy gold and silver is changing real-world supply and prices.
Infosys, TCS sink nearly 6%: Why are IT stocks falling today?A fresh AI development in the US set off a chain reaction that landed right on Dalal Street. This story helps you make sense of the chaos.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT stocks sink, Infosys tumbles over 6%At 9:21 am, the Sensex traded at 83,645.60, down 93.53 points, while the Nifty hovered at 25,718.50, slipping 9.05 points.

Trump's top economic adviser Stephen Miran resigns from White House roleStephen Miran has resigned as chair of the White House's Council of Economic Advisers to focus on his Federal Reserve role. The move follows Trump's nomination of Kevin Warsh to fill Miran's Fed Board seat, signalling shifts in economic leadership.

India set to keep some agriculture protections under US deal: Trump's trade chiefThe Trump administration is finalising the India trade deal, which will cut India's tariffs on US industrial goods from 13.5% to zero while allowing New Delhi to retain some protections on agricultural imports, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.

Which products Americans are searching amid India-US trade dealIndian textiles, diamonds and jewellery dominate exports globally, but American interest appears to rest with a far smaller commodity, a tiny crustacean.

Sensex ends 2,000 points higher: Here's why the stock market jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,072.67 points to close at 83,739.13, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 639.15 points to settle at 25,727.55. The Nifty recorded its best single-day gain since May 2025, showing a strong return of buying interest after recent weakness.

Gold and silver ETFs surge again after three-day slump. What changed today?Gold and silver may stay volatile in the near term, but today's bounce shows investors are still willing to buy dips. Whether the recovery holds will depend on global cues and key support levels.

Did you miss the India-US trade deal stock market rally? Here's what to doEarly signs of the rally were visible even before Indian markets opened. Gift Nifty jumped more than 700 points after the trade deal announcement, signalling a strong start for Dalal Street.

India–US trade deal and the big oil question: What's changing for India?India became one of the largest buyers of discounted Russian crude after 2022, a trend that helped reduce its import bill. US President Donald Trump's announcement indicates that these purchases will eventually decline, but the immediate impact is expected to be limited.

India–US trade deal announced, but why the fine print remains crucialUS President Donald Trump called the changes "effective immediately" on Truth Social, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi confirmed the development shortly afterward. Yet the absence of the actual agreement means much of the deal is being read between the lines rather than from a published document.

Silver, gold rates today: Why prices are rising after recent crashOn the Multi Commodity Exchange, silver prices jumped sharply, while gold also posted strong gains in early trade. MCX silver was trading around Rs 2,53,792 per kg, up Rs 17,531 or 7.42% as of 10 am. MCX gold was near Rs 1,49,101 per 10 grams, higher by Rs 5,110 or 3.55%.

Adani Enterprises stock surges 10% on India–US trade deal. Check top gainersThe India–US trade deal has supercharged sentiment, lifting Adani stocks and other heavyweights sharply. Here's a look at the top gainers as markets rally hard after the landmark announcement.

India-US trade deal: Why it's good news for Sensex, Nifty and the rupeeThe India–US trade deal lifts a long-standing weight off investors' shoulders, giving the Sensex, Nifty and the rupee a cleaner runway. With clarity finally restored, the market's next leg higher suddenly looks more believable.

Sensex jumps 2,500 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,271.45 points to 83,937.54, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 691.70 points to 25,780.10 as of 9:28 am. The sharp rise came as investors reacted to clarity on the India-US trade agreement, which had remained delayed for months and was seen as a key reason behind recent market weakness.

Did India really commit $500 billion to the US, or is the number just big talk?While US President Donald Trump laid out the figure in public, the Indian government has so far not specified what such a commitment involves, raising questions over its scale, timing and credibility.

entertainment.headline: Wuthering Heights first reviews out: Margot Robbie film called bodice-ripping hit First reviews for Emerald Fennell's Wuthering Heights are in, with critics praising the "scorching hot" chemistry between Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. The film is predicted to be a box office hit, describing it as a breathtaking, "bodice-ripping crowd-pleaser" that firmly establishes itself as a masterpiece.

Working with my life: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani spark new project buzz Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, who previously starred together in Shershaah and are married in real life, are set to share the screen once again. The couple have teased their upcoming project with an adorable banter on social media.

Ram Charan, Upasana's cute gift hampers has cute message from daughter Klin Kaara Ram Charan and Upasana gifted elephant-themed hampers marking the arrival of their twins. The hampers included a special message from their daughter Klin Kaara, highlighting family blessings and gratitude.

The Wives: Madhur Bhandarkar completes shoot; everything you need to know Madhur Bhandarkar has completed shooting for his new film The Wives, bringing together an ensemble cast. The film is now heading into post-production. Check out the complete cast, release date and other details of the film.

Inside Mahesh Babu's intense physical prep for Rajamouli's Varanasi Actor Mahesh Babu revealed the extensive physical and martial arts preparations for his character Rudhra in SS Rajamouli's upcoming film Varanasi, highlighting the director's attention to detail and the commitment required for the role.

Priyanka Chopra on rumours of returning to Don, Krrish films amid Varanasi buzz Priyanka Chopra shared her thoughts on transitioning between Hollywood and Indian film sets. She also reacted to the rumours suggesting she's returning to the Don and Krrish franchises.

Saif Ali Khan dons uniform again for Kartavya. Is this the reinvention he needs? Kartavya marks Saif Ali Khan's return to playing a cop in a Netflix crime drama set in India's heartland. The last time he played a cop role worth noting was in Sacred Games.

Mumbai Police enter Bridgerton era with new cyber safety message Mumbai Police turned to an unlikely pop culture reference for a recent cyber safety message, and the internet is paying attention. Here's why their latest approach has everyone talking.

Dacoit avoids clash with Dhurandhar 2, Toxic. Find out new release date The release of Adivi Sesh and Mrunal Thakur's Dacoit has been rescheduled. The film has now been moved away from a crowded box office period, ensuring it does not compete directly with Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar 2 and Yash's Toxic.

Imran Khan links nepotism criticism to quality of work, cites Ranbir Kapoor Imran Khan said the nepotism debate has always existed in the film industry, recalling that he faced similar remarks during his debut.

Border 2 box office Day 12: Sunny Deol's film remains steady, Rs 300 crore in sight Border 2, the Sunny Deol starrer which everyone seemed excited about, entered its second week at the box office and showed a dip in collections. Here's the detailed report of the film and how it's inching close to the Rs 300 crore mark.

Lavanya Tripathi defends Chiranjeevi's past male heir remark amid gender bias claims Actor Lavanya Tripathi has spoken out in support of Chiranjeevi following renewed criticism of his remarks about grandchildren, addressing online backlash and standing by her personal views.

Fact check: Is Salman Khan in Dhurandhar 2? Viral photo has fans guessing A viral photo has put Salman Khan at the centre of Dhurandhar The Revenge buzz, raising questions about surprise appearances and hidden casting twists. Here's a check on whether Salman truly appears in the Dhurandhar sequel.

Anil Kapoor on working with young actors: They are giving me a run for money Anil Kapoor addressed the rising competition in the entertainment industry while announcing his Netflix series Family Business, saying younger actors are "giving me a run for the money." He added that competing with new talent keeps him young and motivated.

Beyond the battlefield: Women of Border 2 give the film its emotional strength From Mona Singh to Sonam Bajwa, the female actors in Border 2 actually held together the drama beyond the battlefield and provided emotional depth to the film's story.

Did you know Varanasi is not Priyanka Chopra's first Telugu film? As buzz builds around Varanasi, questions resurface over Priyanka Chopra's Telugu film debut. Here's why her "first" Telugu outing isn't as straightforward as it seems.

Priyanka Chopra had one request to Rajamouli before joining Varanasi. Any guesses? Priyanka Chopra's return to Indian cinema in SS Rajamouli's upcoming film, Varanasi, includes a special dance sequence at her request, with Mahesh Babu also taking part. The film is slated for April 2027 release.

Ravi Kishan on Bhabhiji Ghar Par Hain, reviving Bhojpuri cinema and more. Exclusive Ravi Kishan channels real-life lovers he has seen in UP and Bihar for his role in Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain! Fun on the Run. In an exclusive to India Today, he also reveals his wish to raise the bar on Bhojpuri cinema with a National Award-worthy film as tribute to his roots.

Saif Ali Khan turns cop for SRK's production venture Kartavya, first look out Saif Ali Khan turns cop for SRK's production venture Kartavya, first-look out as the film was announced at the Next on Netflix event. The streamer also revealed another Khan-led project, Hum Hindustani, set in post-Independence India.

general news.headline: Here's a traitor: Rahul Gandhi jabs aide-turned-BJP minister Ravneet Bittu outside ParliamentRahul Gandhi referred to former Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu as his "traitor friend," prompting a strong response from the BJP leader, who hit back by calling Gandhi a "desh ka dushman" (enemy of the nation).

Live: If you'll allow me, Mamata seeks CJI-led bench's permission to argueBengal SIR SC Hearing Live Updates: The Supreme Court on Wednesday heard a plea filed by West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee challenging the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in the state. She is set to appear before the court and is likely to seek permission from the Chief Justice of India to argue the case in person. Through her legal team, she has filed an interim application requesting the court's approval to make submissions directly. Stay tuned to inditatoday.in to get all the latest updates.

Sorry, papa: Korean game app in focus as 3 Ghaziabad girls die by suicideThree sisters died after they allegedly jumped off the ninth floor of their residential building in Ghaziabad. The victims were allegedly addicted to a task-based Korean gaming app and left behind a suicide note.

Agri, dairy sensitivities addressed in US trade deal, government assures ParliamentUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal spoke in Parliament about the recently announced India-US trade deal, saying that the Indian side was successful in safeguarding the interests of sensitive sectors such as agriculture and dairy.

Why India is fortifying Chicken's Neck with underground railThe Chicken's Neck, India's only land route to the northeast, has repeatedly been used as an intimidation tactic by China, and more recently, Bangladesh. India is now constructing underground railway tracks along the stretch. In this report, we explain why the move is important and the significance of its timing.

Why Anthropic's new AI tools rattled Wall Street's tech giants, hit Indian IT stocksThe slide in IT stocks is not just about prices. It reflects the new uncertainty AI brings to global tech. Knowing what sparked it helps decode what lies ahead for the sector.

Had to leave my marriage: Melinda Gates on Epstein files' STD claim against BillMelinda French Gates has responded to the latest batch of Jeffrey Epstein files that claimed her former husband and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates caught STD after having sex with Russian girls and then tried to secretly give her medication for the disease.

Karnataka horror: Man kills rival for eloping with mother, stands on his bodyKarnataka police said the accused harboured a decade-old grudge against the victim after he eloped with his mother around 10 years ago.

Ghaziabad deaths show gaming culture is breaking young minds. Are we listening?Three children are dead in Ghaziabad, and pretending this was unforeseeable is dishonest. Gaming culture has crossed into psychological risk for young minds, and while India has begun to acknowledge it, the health response is still dangerously incomplete. Silence, at this point, is complicity. This is why every parent, policymaker, and educator needs to read this.

Yesterday was last of 50 tasks: Ghaziabad girls' father blames Korean gameThree minor sisters in Ghaziabad tragically ended their lives, allegedly under the influence of a dangerous online Korean game. Authorities are investigating the digital evidence to uncover how the virtual challenge led to this heartbreaking incident.

India-US deal isn't just a trade deal. It adds muscle to India's China fightUS President Donald Trump's announcement of the finalisation of a broad trade agreement with India is more than Indian exports facing fewer tariffs in America. This is how it boosts India's prospects as it competes with China in manufacturing, exports and strategic weight.

Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: Neighbour watched as horror unfolded at midnightA neighbour said he saw the three girls jumping off the ninth floor of their residential building in Ghaziabad and initially believed he saw a couple and their child taking the extreme step.

Saif Ali Khan dons uniform again for Kartavya. Is this the reinvention he needs?Kartavya marks Saif Ali Khan's return to playing a cop in a Netflix crime drama set in India's heartland. The last time he played a cop role worth noting was in Sacred Games.

The film is predicted to be a box office hit, describing it as a breathtaking, "bodice-ripping crowd-pleaser" that firmly establishes itself as a masterpiece.

My life is very alone: Last scribbles of Ghaziabad sisters, and a diary mentionA suicide note was recovered in which the sisters apologised to their father and asked their parents to read a diary. Scribbles on the wall of a room were also found that read, "I am very, very alone."

Passenger stops man from smoking in train by snatching cigarette, he tries to attackAn Indian Railways passenger stopped a man from smoking inside a train coach. The confrontation, however, escalated when the man allegedly tried to attack him.

A bar in Japan where bartenders offer career advice over free drinksAt this bar, happy hours run all day long. If you are looking for career advice, it might be served with some free drinks and a good listener's ear also.

Businessman dies after delivery agents attack him with helmets in Connaught PlacePolice received a PCR call at around 1:30 am on January 3, reporting an unconscious man lying on the road in a pool of blood. Shivam was rushed to a nearby hospital, where doctors found multiple severe head injuries and a hematoma. Due to his critical condition, he was unable to record a statement.

World Cancer Day: How integrative oncology improves cancer treatment toleranceAs integrative oncology gains attention, a protocol-driven model offers a clear message which is that metabolic and dietary therapies may enhance cancer care but only when anchored firmly to evidence-based treatment, ethics, and rigorous science.

How tiny hydrogen molecule has become Nasa's biggest problemThe mission is meant to send four astronauts on a historic journey around the Moon and back, the first crewed flight of the Artemis program.

I am an oncologist, and cancer showed me why hope matters as much as treatmentAs an oncologist, I've learnt that medicine can treat cancer, but true healing comes from hope, faith, and a calm, conscious mind. When science and spirit move together, patients don't just survive, they learn how to live. That's why I believe this story will resonate with survivors and with those walking beside someone who is ill

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 20 | Bearded Beginning: Rebel's Roots And Rationalist RoarHandcrafted ByOur Editors I have not just been reading, researching, writing and speaking on Periyar from my early years, but in the process internalised and imbibed him impulsively, instinctively and now I fear, irrevocably. He has got under my skin and settled in my system so pervasively I almost feel I am growing a beard.

Ex-Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi's son shot dead at home by armed gangSaif al-Islam Gaddafi's lawyer said that a "four-man commando" unit carried out an "assassination" at his residence in Zintan, a city in western Libya.

sports.headline: IND v SA, T20 World Cup warm-up: Now or never for Sanju Samson? IND vs SA, T20 World Cup warm-up match: Even champions have doubts to settle. India's warm-up against South Africa doubles as a selection trial, with Sanju Samson's opening spot under threat from the in-form Ishan Kishan this week.

IND U19 vs AFG U19 live: Afghanistan opt to bat first despite testy conditions India (IND) vs Afghanistan (AFG)) Live Score, U19 World Cup 2026 semifinal: India have lost the toss and have been sent to bowl first in the semi-final of the tournament. India have not played in this venue yet.

Boycott India, forget Super 8s: Why rain is Pakistan's biggest foe in Colombo T20 World Cup: Pakistan have decided to boycott their group stage match against India in Colombo. But can they afford to waste a game when two of their other matches are threatened by rain?

T20 World Cup: Pakistan can brag about series win, but don't count Australia out Pakistan have every right to enjoy a 3-0 sweep of Australia so close to a T20 World Cup, but the context tempers the celebration. Australia travelled with a depleted squad and used the series as preparation, and history shows they have often stumbled before global tournaments, only to find their best form when it matters most.

Can India defend T20 World Cup? MS Dhoni gives his verdict on Suryakumar's team MS Dhoni believes India are primed for a historic T20 World Cup title defence at home. The former captain, however, warns that dew and toss conditions could still decide crunch matches.

Pakistan being unfair to own players with India boycott: Kapil Dev Kapil Dev has warned Pakistan that boycotting India at the T20 World Cup will only hurt their own players. He says the ICC consequences will linger long after the headlines fade.

Carabao Cup: Arsenal boost treble hopes as Chelsea win books final spot Arsenal edge past Chelsea to reach the Carabao Cup final and keep a multi-trophy season alive. With Wembley booked, Arteta's side quietly strengthen their treble hopes and keep the quadruple dream ticking.

U-19 World Cup: Invincible India take on resilient Afghanistan for a spot in the final Having stormed into the semi-finals without dropping a single game in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 so far, India will face the underdogs Afghanistan in the all-important clash. The Ayush Mhatre-led side will look to advance to the final without much trouble, to take on England in the summit clash.

England complete T20 series sweep vs Sri Lanka to cap ideal World Cup build-up England completed a 3-0 T20I series sweep over Sri Lanka with a 12-run victory in the third and final match at Pallekele, rounding off their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup on a high.

Gautam Gambhir ignores question on Pakistan's T20 World Cup boycott vs India India head coach Gautam Gambhir refused to comment on Pakistan's boycott stance against India ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. Pakistan government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Pakistan will backtrack on India boycott stance in 4-5 days: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin believes Pakistan will reverse its decision not to play India in the T20 World Cup 2026. The ICC has warned PCB of serious consequences if they choose to move ahead with their stance of not playing against the arch-rivals on February 15 in Colombo.

Dominant Delhi Capitals rout Gujarat Giants to set up final against RCBWomen's Premier League Eliminator: Delhi Capitals crushed Gujarat Giants by seven wickets to reach their fourth consecutive WPL final, setting up a high-stakes showdown against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Snubbed from IPL, T20 World Cup, Steve Smith finds a taker in PSLAfter going unsold at the Indian Premier League 2026 auction, Australia great Steve Smith has been signed by Sialkot Stallionz for the 11th season of the Pakistan Super League.

Try banning Pakistan: Ex-Pak cricketer challenges ICC over India match boycottT20 World Cup 2026: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali criticised the International Cricket Council, daring it to take punitive action against Pakistan if the team forfeits its match against India on February 15. Ali argued that the Pakistan Cricket Board, acting on government directives, cannot be penalised by the global cricket body.

Thomas Rew's hundred powers England past Australia into finalCaptain Thomas Rew struck a battling century as England sealed their place in Friday's Under-19 World Cup final with a 27-run victory over Australia in the first semi-final.

Please don't do this: When Ponting couldn't convince Delhi to retain T20 starFormer Australian captain Ricky Ponting said that in 2018, during his time with Abhishek Sharma at Delhi Capitals in the IPL, he urged the franchise's owners to retain the young batter and not let him go.

Fresh trouble for Pakistan: Broadcasters may sue PCB over India match boycottT20 World Cup 2026: More trouble is brewing for Pakistan. Beyond the threat of severe sanctions from the International Cricket Council, the tournament's broadcaster may take legal action against the Pakistan Cricket Board if the senior national team boycotts the February 15 match against India.

New MCC laws explained: 10 rule changes coming to cricket in October 2026The Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) has announced 10 major rule changes that will reshape how the game is played, with the new laws coming into effect on 1 October 2026.

GG vs DC Eliminator Highlights: Delhi storm into 4th successive final with 7-wicket winGujarat Giants (GG) vs Delhi Capitals (DC) Live score, WPL 2026 Eliminator: Delhi Capitals have qualified for their fourth successive Women's Premier League final with a seven-wicket victory over Gujarat Giants in the Eliminator in Vadodara.

Gold medal for chaos: Cricket a glorious mess before much-awaited Olympics returnThe T20 World Cup 2026, featuring 20 teams, was meant to showcase cricket's global future. Instead, it has revived old habits, dragging the sport back into familiar, self-made chaos. With two years to go before cricket's Olympic return, the ICC needs to set its house in order.

Alcaraz was like baby Nadal: Ex-tennis player recalls incredible storyThe Australian Open champion, Carlos Alcaraz, was just 14 when he first left a seasoned top-10 professional searching for answers. More than a decade later, Spain's Davis Cup captain David Ferrer believes that fleeting practice-court moment already carried unmistakable shades of a young Rafael Nadal.

Pakistan shouldn't play vs India, was ICC sleeping before? Former cricketerFormer Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal supports PCB's decision to boycott the India match in the T20 World Cup 2026, citing ICC's biased approach. Pakistan's government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Gavaskar trolls Pakistan over T20 World Cup stand: Waiting for their U-turnT20 World Cup: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar has trolled Pakistan over their stand of boycotting India in the T20 World Cup 2026. Gavaskar said that he is awaiting a U-turn that Pakistani players are infamously known for.

T20 World Cup boycott row: What Pakistan risks by forfeiting India matchT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan could face severe sanctions if it goes ahead and forfeits their match against India. While Pakistan has confirmed participation in the tournament, its refusal to face India in Sri Lanka has opened the door to possible ICC sanctions.

WPL 2026 Eliminator: Gujarat chase first final against Jemimah's CapitalsDelhi Capitals and Gujarat Giants collide in a do-or-die WPL 2026 Eliminator in Vadodara. With a final spot at stake, recent thrillers suggest another nerve-shredding finish awaits.

Tests over T20? Cummins says he did not want to risk himself for World CupAustralia fast bowler Pat Cummins has broken his silence on missing the T20 World Cup. Cummins has explained why he did not want to risk himself in the world tournament.

Karim Benzema joins Al Hilal: How the transfer caused a Ronaldo riot in SaudiBenzema's move to Al-Hilal and Ronaldo's protest have exposed cracks in Saudi football's power balance. What began as squad building has spiralled into a league-wide debate on fairness, control and ambition.

CSK in WPL? Team to start investing in women's cricket, reveals CEOChennai Super Kings are set to invest in women's cricket, confirmed the team's CEO Kasi Viswanathan. Till now, CSK has stayed away from investing in women's cricket despite the advent of the WPL.

Despite thrashing vs Pakistan, Ponting backs Australia to reach top 4 in T20 WCT20 World Cup: Former cricketer Ricky Ponting has backed Australia to reach the semi-final of the T20 World Cup. Ponting has shown confidence in the side, despite the team getting battered by Pakistan in the 3-match T20I series.

Watch: Ishan Kishan cracks up revisiting old viral clip with Rohit SharmaIshan Kishan burst into laughter revisiting an old viral clip with Rohit Sharma, joking about how three missed matches turned into two lost years. The throwback landed just as his red-hot form reignited his T20 World Cup push.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
